Name: Charles Clark
Notes: Lawyer and publisher ; an expert on copyright

Name: J Duncan M Derrett
Notes: Professor of Oriental Laws in the University of London ( 1965-1982 )

Name: Sir David William Evans
Notes: Welsh solicitor who was director and legal advisor of the King Edward VII National Memorial Association for the Prevention and Treatment of Tuberculosis , and knighted for public services to Wales ; previously won his Blue in rugby ( 1887 and 1888 ) and played as a Welsh rugby union international , winning six caps ( 1889-1891 )

Name: Sidney Hayward QC
Degree: BA Jurisprudence ( 2nd ) ( 1st class in Mods in Mathematics )
Notes: Barrister and writer on housing and planning law

Name: Alfred Hazel ( F/P )
Degree: BA Literae Humaniores ( 2nd , 1892 ) , BA Jurisprudence ( 1st , 1893 ) , BCL ( 2nd )
Notes: All Souls Reader in English Law , Liberal MP for West Bromwich ( 1906 - January 1910 )

Name: Sir David Lewis ( HF )
Notes: Former senior partner of Norton Rose Fulbright , Lord Mayor of London ( 2007-2008 )

Name: Llywarch Reynolds
Notes: Welsh solicitor and Celtic scholar ; many of the antiquarian manuscripts he collected are now held by the National Library of Wales

Name: John Williams
Notes: Transferred to Wadham College and graduated from there ; serjeant-at-law and legal writer

Name: Edward Wynne ( F )
Notes: Advocate at Doctors ' Commons , chancellor of the Diocese of Hereford and an Anglesey landowner

Name: Edward Wynne
Notes: Barrister and legal writer ; son of the lawyer William Wynne

Name: William Wynne
Notes: Serjeant-at-law and author of The Life of Sir Leoline Jenkins ( 1724 ) ; son of Owen Wynne and father of barrister Edward Wynne
